# Question

Write a function `timezone_bumper(dt,bump)` that increases any provided timestamp by `bump::Int` hours (defaults to +3 hours). Make sure it works only for DateTime types and throws an error for Date types.

```julia
function timezone_bumper(dt::DateTime, bump::Int=3)
    new_time = LocalTime(dt) + bump*Hour
    return new_time |> to_utc |> utc_datetime
end
```
This function uses the `LocalTime` and `utc_datetime` functions from the `Dates` module to convert a local time to UTC and back, applying a timezone bump of `bump` hours. It is designed to work only with `DateTime` types and will throw an error if a `Date` type is provided.
